title: Jackson Barnett
text:
I’m an environmental scientist, finishing my Masters Degere in Environmental Studies at Virginia Commonwealth University. Currently, I split my time between researching the drivers of light attenuation in Virginia reservoirs, and teaching an undergraduate ecology course. In prior roles, I have worked assessing stream impairments for TMDL creation, creating remote water quality monitoring stations, and monitoring a series of urban streams across Richmond, Va. By training I’m either a limnologist (specializing in light, sediment, and algae interactions) or an hydrologist; professionally, I am interested in freshwater ecology, data analysis, GIS, and protecting Virginia’s water resources.
On this site I keep a porfolio of representative academic documents, presentations, and my CV/Resume.



View award-winning research poster here. - 1st place in the 2024 VWEA & WaterJAM Poster Contest
Viw description of Masters Thesis project on my CV. and Resume.
